member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob
member.summary: Base class for binary large objects.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.STANDARD
member.summary: Indicates, that standard behavior is requested: blob is loaded completely into memory.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.INCREMENTAL
member.summary: Indicates, that non-standard behavior is requested: blob is loaded chunkwise into memory. Only available with the FastObjects backend.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Sets the position within the current Blob. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the origin parameter.
A value of type SeekOrigin indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current Blob.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Changes the size of a Blob. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.param: The new length of the Blob in bytes.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.Close
member.summary: Flushes the content of the Blob. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.Flush
member.summary: Clears all buffers for this Blob and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte from the Blob and advances the position within the Blob by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the Blob. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.returns: The value at the current position of -1 if the end has been reached.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the specified position. The current position within the Blob is not modified. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.param: The byte array to contain the data read. The length of the array determines the number of bytes to be read.
The position in the Blob to begin reading from (zero based).
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not available, or zero (0) if the end of the Blob has been reached.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.
is null.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a number of bytes from to the specified position and advances the position within the Blob by the number of bytes read. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.param: An array of bytes. Contains the byte values of the Blob between offset and (offset + count - 1) when this method returns.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current Blob.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current Blob position.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not available, or zero (0) if the end of the Blob has been reached.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.
is too small.
Illegal value of or .

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes a byte to the Blob and advances the position within the Blob by one byte. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.param: The byte value to write to the current position.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a sequence of bytes to the current Blob position and advances the current position by the number of bytes written. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies bytes from buffer to the current Blob.

The zero-based byte offset in
from which to begin copying bytes to the current Blob.
The number of bytes to be written to the current Blob.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.
is too small.
Illegal value of or .

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a sequence of bytes to the current Blob at the specified position. The current position within this Blob is not changed. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.param: The position in the Blob to begin writing (zero based).
The byte array containing the data to be written. The length of the array determines the number of bytes written.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.
is null.

member.exception: Blob was closed before.

member.summary: Logs no events. Use this only while doing benchmarking.

member.summary: Logs majority of the events (this slows down the performance, recommended only for debugging purposes)

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.LoggingLevel.All
member.summary: Logs all possible events (this slows down the performance significantly, could be used while debugging)

member.summary: An 8-bit integer ranging in value from -128 to 127.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Int16
member.summary: An integral type representing signed 16-bit integers with values between -32768 and 32767.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Int32
member.summary: An integral type representing signed 32-bit integers with values between -2147483648 and 2147483647.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Int64
member.summary: An integral type representing signed 64-bit integers with values between -9223372036854775808 and 9223372036854775807.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.UInt64
member.summary: An integral type representing unsigned 64-bit integers with values between 0 and 18446744073709551615.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Guid
member.summary: A globally unique identifier (or GUID).

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Float
member.summary: Identifies the generic SQL type FLOAT. Different backends use different representations of this type.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Real
member.summary: Identifies the generic SQL type REAL. Different backends use different representations of this type.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Double
member.summary: A floating point type representing values ranging from approximately 5.0 x 10 -324 to 1.7 x 10 308 with a precision of 15-16 digits.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Numeric
member.summary: Identifies the generic SQL type NUMERIC. Different backends use different representations of this type.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Decimal
member.summary: A simple type representing values ranging from 1.0 x 10 -28 to approximately 7.9 x 10 28 with 28-29 significant digits.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Character
member.summary: A simple type representing a character.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Varchar
member.summary: A type representing a VARCHAR value in the database. Different backends use different representations of this type.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.LongVarchar
member.summary: A type representing a LONGVARCHAR value in the database. Different backends use different representations of this type.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.StringFixedLength
member.summary: A type representing a CHAR value in the database with length greater than zero. Different backends use different representations of this type.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.StringVariableLength
member.summary: A type representing a VARCHAR value in the database. Different backends use different representations of this type.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.StringInfiniteLength
member.summary: A type representing a VARCHAR value in the database with maximum length allowed by the database server. Different backends use different representations of this type.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.UnicodeCharacter
member.summary: A simple type representing a unicode character.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.UnicodeStringFixedLength
member.summary: A type representing a NCHAR value in the database. Different backends use different representations of this type.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.UnicodeStringVariableLength
member.summary: A type representing a NVARCHAR value in the database. Different backends use different representations of this type.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.UnicodeStringInfiniteLength
member.summary: A type representing a NVARCHAR value in the database with maximum length allowed by the database server. Different backends use different representations of this type.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Currency
member.summary: A type representing currency data. Implemented as Money in most backends.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Date
member.summary: A type representing a date value. Different backends use different representations of this type.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Time
member.summary: A type representing a time value. Different backends use different representations of this type.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.DateTime
member.summary: A type representing a date and time value. Different backends use different representations of this type.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Binary
member.summary: A type representing a fixed length BINARY value in the database. Different backends use different representations of this type.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.VarBinary
member.summary: A type representing a variable length VARBINARY with a maximum length of 8000. Different backends use different representations of this type.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.LongVarBinary
member.summary: A type representing a variable length LONGVARBINARY value in the database. Different backends use different representations of this type.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Object
member.summary: A general type representing any polymorphic persistent reference.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Blob
member.summary: A variable-length stream of binary data ranging between 1 and 8,000 bytes.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Clob
member.summary: A variable-length stream of character data ranging between 1 and 8,000 bytes.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Cursor
member.summary: A type representing a cursor.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Other
member.summary: A type representing a type not explicitly represented by another DbType value.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Variant

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.AssociationType
member.summary: Defines the type of associations available in the Telerik OpenAccess ORM meta model.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.AssociationType.Reference
member.summary: Specifies an unary association (that has a 'role' only on one of the ends), and the 'end role' is implemented as a reference property.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.AssociationType.PolymorphicReference
member.summary: Specifies an unary association (that has a 'role' only on one of the ends), and the 'end role' is implemented as a reference to a class hierarchy or interface.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.AssociationType.Collection
member.summary: Specifies an unary association (that has a 'role' only on one of the ends), and the 'end role' is implemented as a collection property.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.AssociationType.OneToOne
member.summary: Specifies a binary association that has both ends of the association set: both sides are implemented as reference properties.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.AssociationType.OneToMany
member.summary: Specifies a binary association that has both ends of the association set: one is reference property and the other is the corresponding collection (calculated).

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.AssociationType.OneToManyJointable
member.summary: Specifies a unary association (that has a 'role' only on one of the ends) and the 'end role ' is implemented using a join table.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.AssociationType.ManyToManyJointable
member.summary: Specifies a binary association that has both ends of the association set: both sides are implemented as collection properties. The association is implemented using a join table.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.AssociationType.DictionaryJointable
member.summary: Specifies a binary association that has both ends of the association set: one is the dictionary and the other can be a reference or a key value property to another dictionary.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.AssociationType.StructReference
member.summary: Specifies an unary association (that has a 'role' only on one of the ends), and the 'end role' is implemented as a structure (value object) property. NOT SUPPORTED currently.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.AllowReadAfterDelete
member.summary: Controls if read operations on the already deleted instances are allowed.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.Hyperdrive
member.summary: For internal use only
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.ClassBehavior

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.CacheReferenceType

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.ReturnNullForRowNotFound

member.summary: Controls if the opening of a database requires persistent classes to be present.
member.value: Default: true

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.Optimistic
member.summary: Controls if optimistic transactions are used or pessimistic locking is to be performed.
member.value: Default: true

member.summary: Specifies which concurrency control is used

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.RetainConnectionInOptimisticTransaction
member.summary: Controls if the connection is to be retained in optimistic transactions.

member.summary: Specifies that the default value for the identity type will be used by the runtime.

member.summary: Specifies that the identity is managed internally for the type by Telerik OpenAccess ORM and it is not visible as a field in the type.

member.summary: Specifies that a single field in the respective type will hold the identity information.

member.summary: Specifies that a multiple fields in the respective type will hold the identity information. Also one needs to provide a class that implements the IOblectId and manages the identity information.

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.InheritanceStrategy
member.summary: Defines identifiers for types of inheritance provided by the Telerik OpenAccess ORM.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.InheritanceStrategy.Default
member.summary: Specifies that the default value for the inheritance strategy will be used by the runtime.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.InheritanceStrategy.Flat
member.summary: Defines an inheritance strategy where all classes share a single table. Discriminator column is required for the complete definition.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.InheritanceStrategy.Vertical
member.summary: Defines an inheritance strategy where each type has its own table. The table contains only the members defined for the respective type. The root base type table must contain a discriminator column.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.InheritanceStrategy.Horizontal
member.summary: Defines an inheritance strategy where each type has its own table. As the base types should be abstract, they will not have tables mapped to them and every concrete type will have columns that contain base class fields information.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.NullValueBehavior.Exception
member.summary: Specifies that an exception will be raised when a field has null value assigned

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.NullValueBehavior.Default
member.summary: Specifies that the default action will be taken, should null value be assigned to a field

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.OptimisticConcurrencyControlStrategy
member.summary: Specifies the concurrency control options for the persistent types in the Telerik OpenAccess ORM meta model.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OptimisticConcurrencyControlStrategy.Default
member.summary: Defines that the default value for the optimistic concurrency control strategy will be used by the runtime.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OptimisticConcurrencyControlStrategy.None
member.summary: Defines that no concurrency checks will be done on the database server.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OptimisticConcurrencyControlStrategy.Version
member.summary: Defines that a version column is used to detect concurrent updates. The version number is incremented on every update and the previous version number is included in the where clause. This is the fastest and safest optimistic concurrency control mode. This is the default and suggested concurrency mode.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OptimisticConcurrencyControlStrategy.Timestamp
member.summary: Defines that a timestamp column is to be used to detect concurrent updates. The timestamp is set on every update and the previous value is included in the where clause. This may not be safe if updates happen quicker than the resolution of the timestamp field. It is included to support legacy database schemas.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OptimisticConcurrencyControlStrategy.Changed
member.summary: Defines that previous values of all changed columns will be included in the where clause. This provides more fine-grained optimistic concurrency control as different transactions may modify different fields of the same instance. This mode can be used when the database schema allows no modifications (adding a version column for example). Float and double fields are excluded as they are not exact (rounding procedures are different across databases and also differ from the way .NET is handling it).

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OptimisticConcurrencyControlStrategy.Backend
member.summary: Defines that a backend specific concurrency control mechanism is used.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OptimisticConcurrencyControlStrategy.All
member.summary: Defines that the values of all columns (changed or not) will be included in the where clause.

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.CacheStrategy
member.summary: Describes the strategy for the database level cache

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.CacheStrategy.Default
member.summary: Specifies that the default value for the cache strategy will be used by the runtime.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.CacheStrategy.No
member.summary: Do not cache instances of this class.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.CacheStrategy.Yes
member.summary: Cache instances of this class.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.CacheStrategy.All
member.summary: Cache all instances of this class as soon as an instance is requested. All rows from its table will be read and cached whenever an instance is requested but not found in cache. This may work well for small static tables when using a big cache.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.RefreshMode.PreserveChanges
member.summary: Keeps the actual changes in the object but re-reads all clean data. The object will stay dirty.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.RefreshMode.OverwriteChangesFromStore

member.summary: Declares a class to be persistence-capable; instances of such a class can be made persistent in a database.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.PersistentAttribute.Identity
member.summary: Determines, whether the identity for objects is automatically provided by the runtime system (internal identity) or is provided by the values of certain fields of an object.
member.value: If set to a particular System.Type and not null then single field identity is used, otherwise internal identity is used. Defaults to null, meaning internal identity.

member.summary: ApplicationIdentity is obsolete, please use Identity instead.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.PersistentAttribute.VersionField

member.summary: Determines, whether the identity for objects is automatically provided by the runtime system (internal identity) or is provided by the values of certain fields of an object. Only intended for situations, where no type, but a string can be specified. (e.g. J#)

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchPlan
member.summary: Interface for setting and changing the actual FetchPlan.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchPlan.Default
member.summary: Default FetchGroup name definition.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchPlan.All
member.summary: Maximum FetchGroup name definition.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchPlan.DefaultMaxDepth
member.summary: Default value for maximum fetch depth.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchPlan.NoLimit
member.summary: Unlimited retrieval of objects in one fetch operation.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchPlan.DefaultLimit
member.summary: Default value for retrieval of objects in one fetch operation.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchPlan.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchPlan.#ctor(System.String[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance.
member.param: The FetchGroup array consists of FetchGroup name that has to be defined as [FetchField(groupName)] at the field of a class that you want to fetch. FetchPlan.Default or FetchPlan.All is also possible.
Controls the maximum tree depth for an object to be fetched. This assigns the value of the MaxDepth property.
Value for retrieval of objects in one fetch operation. This assigns the value of the Limit property.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchPlan.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a FetchGroup name to the actual FetchPlan definition.
member.param: The FetchGroup name has to be defined as [FetchField(groupName)] at the field of a class that you want to fetch. FetchPlan.Default or FetchPlan.All is also possible.
member.returns: Returns the changed FetchPlan. You can call: scope.FetchPlan.Add("grp1").Add("grp2")... several times.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchPlan.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a FetchGroup name from the actual FetchPlan definition.
member.param: The FetchGroup name has to be defined as [FetchField(groupName)] at the field of a class that you want to fetch. FetchPlan.Default or FetchPlan.All is also possible.
member.returns: Returns the changed FetchPlan. You can call: scope.FetchPlan.Remove("grp1").Remove("grp2")... several times.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchPlan.Clear
member.summary: Clears the actual FetchPlan definition.
member.returns: Returns the changed FetchPlan. You can call: scope.FetchPlan.Clear().Add("grp1").Add("grp2")... several times.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchPlan.Set(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces the actual FetchPlan by a single FetchGroup name.
member.param: The FetchGroup name has to be defined as [FetchField(groupName)] at the field of a class that you want to fetch. FetchPlan.Default or FetchPlan.All is also possible.
member.returns: Returns the changed FetchPlan. You can call: scope.FetchPlan.Set("grp0").Add("grp1").Add("grp2")... several times.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchPlan.Set(System.String[])
member.summary: Replaces the actual FetchPlan by an string array of FetchGroup names.
member.param: The FetchGroup names has to be defined as [FetchField(groupName)] at the field of a class that you want to fetch. FetchPlan.Default or FetchPlan.All is also possible.
member.returns: Returns the changed FetchPlan. You can call: scope.FetchPlan.Set(groupName).Add("grp1").Remove("grp2")... several times.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchPlan.GetGroupNames
member.summary: Gets the actual FetchPlan definition.
member.returns: The FetchGroup names have to be defined as [FetchField(groupName)] at the field of a class that you want to fetch. FetchPlan.Default or FetchPlan.All is also possible.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchPlan.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string that represents the current FetchPlan.
member.returns: A that represents the current FetchPlan.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchPlan.Limit
member.summary: Controls the maximum number of objects that can be fetched together.
member.value: An integer >=0. 0 means no limit! The default value is .

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchPlan.MaxDepth
member.summary: Controls the maximum tree depth that is fetched together.
member.value: An integer >=1. Default is .

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.IMovableEnumerator.Move(System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the enumerator forwards or backwards by a specified number of elements.

member.summary: deprecated; behaves identical like WRITE

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.ITransactionProperties
member.summary: Controls the properties of a database transaction.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ITransactionProperties.RetainValues
member.summary: Controls whether persistent objects retain their values after commit of the transaction and if read access is allowed. Default is true.
member.value: Default is true.
member.exception: Transaction is active.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ITransactionProperties.RestoreValues
member.summary: Controls whether the values of persistent objects are restored to their original values when the transaction (or one particular nesting level) is rolled back. Default is false.
member.value: Default is false.
member.exception: Transaction is active.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ITransactionProperties.Concurrency
member.summary: Controls the concurrency of the transaction. Default is TransactionMode.OPTIMISTIC_NO_LOST_UPDATES.
member.value: Default is TransactionMode.OPTIMISTIC_NO_LOST_UPDATES.
member.exception: Transaction is active.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ITransactionProperties.RefreshReadObjectsInNewTransaction
member.summary: Determines, whether objects that were read (but not modified) in a previous transaction are refreshed upon the first access in a subsequent transaction. Default is True; use with care!
member.value: Default is true.
member.exception: Transaction is active.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ITransactionProperties.AutomaticBegin
member.summary: Determines, whether a transaction is always active (automatically started).
member.value: The default is false.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ITransactionProperties.FailFast
member.summary: Determines, whether a transaction commit or flush should fail on the first failure.
member.value: The default is true.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ITransactionProperties.ReadAfterDelete
member.summary: Controls whether the values of persistent objects are accessible when the object is marked for deletion. Default is false.
member.value: Default is false.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.ITransactionProperties.EnableDataSynchronization
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that determines whether the context behaves in data synchronization mode when it executes Insert and Update operations. If the Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessContextBase is in this mode, the DateTime and version fields that are automatically set by OpenAccess will not be calculated.
member.returns: A value that is true when data synchronization mode is enabled; otherwise false.

summary.para: Implementation of a container for networks of persistent objects which are disconnected from a database. The ObjectContainer implements change tracking and can be used later to reapply the offline changes to a database.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectContainer.CopyFrom(Telerik.OpenAccess.IObjectScope,System.String,System.Object,Telerik.OpenAccess.IObjectCollector)
member.summary: Creates a copy of each specified persistent root object and adds it to the ObjectContainer.
member.param: The source IObjectScope to copy from.
The name of the list under which the added objects should be retrievable.

Persistent object that is to be added to the container. Can also be of type IEnumerable or IEnumerator in which case all contained objects are added to the container.
In the case where a persistent capable class also implements IEnumerable or IEnumerator, the object network for only this class' object is calculated. The contained objects are not enumerated.

An implementation of the IObjectCollector interface used to calculate the object network for each of the root objects.
This parameter can be null, in which case only the root objects are added to the contatiner.
member.exception: When the source scope object is not accessible.
When the source scope transaction mode is pessimistic and the object cannot be locked.
When the source scope object was referenced but is deleted in the database.

member.param: The target IObjectScope to copy to.
Specifies which verifiable objects are verified and locked.
member.exception: When the changes stored in the container cannot be applied to the target object scope because the database content was changed concurrently.
When an object could not be accessed from the database.

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectContainer.Verify
member.summary: Specification of the conflict detection and resolution for importing objects into an object scope.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectContainer.Verify.All
member.summary: All objects from the object source context will be verified (except new objets).

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectContainer.Verify.Changed
member.summary: Only changed/deleted objects from the object source context will be verified.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectContainer.Verify.None
member.summary: No object from the object source context will be verified.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectContainer.Verify.Lock
member.summary: All verified objects from the source context will also get locked. The lock mode used depends on action required (read or write/delete). The lock will be granted even if the optimistic verification fails (there was a concurrent change to the object).
